Name: Aragorn (Core)
Card Text: Response: After Aragorn commits to a quest, spend 1 resource from his resource pool to ready him.
Notes: As always, this Response is optional but if desired it must be triggered immediately after Aragorn is committed to a quest.  This can't allow Aragorn to quest more than once in the same round.  He is still committed to the quest until the end of the phase even if you ready him.

Name: Théodred
Card Text: Response: After Théodred commits to a quest, choose a hero committed to that quest.  Add 1 resource to that hero's resource pool.
Notes: Can add resource to himself or any other Hero owned by any player.  Théodred can add resource to Aragorn (CORE 1) who can use the resource to ready himself if they both are committed to the quest by the same player. If Aragorn was already committed by another player he would not be able to immediately use this resource (official FAQ).  Can only commit to a quest once per game turn, even if you have a way to ready him.

Name: Glóin (Core)
Card Text: Response: After Glóin suffers damage, add 1 resource to his resource pool for each point of damage he just suffered.

Name: Gimli (Core)
Card Text: Gimli gets +1 Attack for each damage token on him.

Name: Legolas (Core)
Card Text: Response: After Legolas participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, place 2 progress tokens on the current quest.
Notes: If you have an active Location, progress tokens are placed there instead of the current Quest card  (official FAQ v1.1).  This benefit occurs any time Legolas is part of an attack that destroys an enemy, whether he attacks alone or with somebody else.

Name: Thalin
Card Text: While Thalin is committed to a quest, deal 1 damage to each enemy as it is revealed by the encounter deck.
Notes: The ability resolves before any keyword (including Doomed and Surge) or When Revealed effects on the enemy which are never triggered if the ability destroys the enemy (official FAQ).

Name: Éowyn (Core)
Card Text: Action: Discard 1 card from your hand to give Éowyn +1 Willpower until the end of the phase. This effect may be triggered by each player once each round.
Notes:
This Action can be used after new Encounter cards are revealed during the Quest phase, allowing you to increase her total Willpower based on what cards came out.
If you have multiple Actions that require you to discard a card, each one requires you to discard a separate card.

Name: Eleanor
Card Text: Response: Exhaust Eleanor to cancel the "when revealed" effects of a treachery card just revealed by the encounter deck. Then, discard that card, and replace it with the next card from the encounter deck.
Notes:
Eleanor's Response can be used during initial game Setup if necessary, but remember that When Revealed effects don't occur unless the setup text specifically says to "reveal" cards (official FAQ v1.1).

Can't cancel other keywords, just When Revealed.  Any When Revealed effects and keywords on the replacement card are still resolved because it is considered "Revealed" (errata, FAQ 1.2).

Name: Dúnhere
Card Text: Dúnhere can target enemies in the staging area when he attacks alone. When doing so, he gets +1 Attack.
Notes:
This attack is done only during the normal Attack portion of the Combat phase and you must exhaust Dúnhere as usual.  In other words, all aspects of the attack are normal except the choice of enemy that can be attacked.  Note that this does not cause the enemy to engage the player: the enemy that is attacked remains in the staging area.
With the core set, there can only be one Dúnhere in play and he is the only character who can attack enemies in the staging area, so he will always be doing this alone.  Other characters can still attack enemies you are engaged with as normal.

Name: Denethor (Core)
Card Text: Action: Exhaust Denethor to look at the top card of the encounter deck. You may move that card to the bottom of the deck.

Name: Glorfindel (Core)
Card Text: Action: Pay 1 resource from Glorfindel's pool to heal 1 damage on any character. (Limit once per round.)
Notes: Includes other players' characters.

Name: Beravor
Card Text: Action: Exhaust Beravor to choose a player. That player draws 2 cards.
Notes:
Should read: "Action: Exhaust Beravor to choose
a player. That player draws 2 cards. Limit once per
round.

Name: Faramir (Core)
Card Text: Action: Exhaust Faramir to choose a player. Each character controlled by that player gets +1 Willpower until end of the phase.
Notes: Note that if you choose to exhaust Faramir for the Action, he did not commit to the quest and cannot contribute his Willpower.  Also remember that, assuming you haven't exhausted him to commit him to the quest, his Action can be performed after new Encounter cards are added to the staging area and before total willpower is calculated.

Name: Son of Arnor
Card Text: Response: After Son of Arnor enters play, choose an enemy card in the staging area or currently engaged with another player. Engage that enemy.
Notes: Remember, Responses are optional, but if you chose to do this then the enemy remains engaged with you from this point forward. Engage doesn't mean attack, or defend. It means simply moving the enemy to your player area as if you had engaged it during the engagement phase. This is helpful at getting rid of some threat in the staging area or removing an enemy that might otherwise kill another player from their staging area to yours.

Name: Snowbourn Scout
Card Text: Response: After Snowbourn Scout enters play, choose a location. Place 1 progress token on that location.
Notes: This can include your current Location or any Locations in the staging area, but not the Quest card.

Name: Longbeard Orc Slayer
Card Text: Response: After Longbeard Orc Slayer enters play, deal 1 damage to each Orc enemy in play.
Notes: Instantly damages every Enemy with the Orc trait in play (in staging area or engaged with a player).

Name: Brok Ironfist
Card Text: Response: After a Dwarf hero you control leaves play, put Brok Ironfist into play from your hand.
Notes: If you trigger the Response, you do not need to pay any resources when putting Brok into play from your hand, in fact you don't even need a Leadership Hero to use this Response.  This Response is not triggered by a hero being taken prisoner. This is a bit unusual for an Ally in that the Response is triggered when the card is not yet in-play.

Name: Ever Vigilant
Card Text: Action: Choose and ready 1 ally card.
Notes: An Ally belonging to any player may be selected.

Name: Common Cause
Card Text: Action: Exhaust 1 hero you control to choose and ready a different hero.
Notes:
Even though the cost is 0, you must still have a Leadership Hero under your control (alive and not captured) to play this card.
Readied Hero can be controlled by any player.

Name: For Gondor!
Card Text: Action: Until the end of the phase, all characters get +1 Attack. All Gondor characters also get +1 Defense until the end of the phase.
Notes: All characters (Heroes and Allies, belonging to all players) get +1 Attack until the end of the current phase only.  Only characters with the Gondor trait get +1 Defense.  More than one copy can be played during the same phase.

Name: Sneak Attack
Card Text: Action: Put 1 ally card into play from your hand. At the end of the phase, if that ally is still in play, return it to your hand.
Notes:
You only pay the 1 Leadership resource for this card, not the cost of the Ally you bring into play (resource type of the Ally doesn't matter).  Any damage on the Ally is discarded when returned to your hand.
Note the word Phase: the ally will only be in-play during a single phase (e.g. Quest or Attack are the most common phases in which to use this card).

Name: Valiant Sacrifice
Card Text: Response: After an ally card leaves play, that card's controller draws 2 cards.
Notes:
Multiple copies of Valiant Sacrifice can be triggered off of one ally leaving play, but each Valiant Sacrifice card played can only allow you to draw 2 cards one time.  After Sneak Attack (CORE 23) causes a character to leave play and after Gandalf (CORE 73) leaves play this is triggered as well.
Can take place before or after other Responses to the same event since you can always choose the order in which they are resolved (official FAQ).

Name: Grim Resolve
Card Text: Action: Ready all character cards in play.
Notes: Characters include Heroes and Allies.

Name: Steward of Gondor
Card Text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains the Gondor trait. Action: Exhaust Steward of Gondor to add 2 resources to attached hero's resource pool.
Notes: You only have to exhaust the Steward of Gondor, not the attached Hero.  You can do this once every game round, effectively allowing the Hero to collect 3 resources per round instead of the usual 1.  These can be gained and immediately spent in the same Phase 2 you played this card in if so desired.

Name: Celebrían's Stone
Card Text: Attach to a hero. Restricted. Attached hero gains +2 Willpower. If attached hero is Aragorn, he also gains a Spirit resource icon.
Notes: Note that this does not grant an extra resource token, it means all resource tokens in Aragorn's (CORE 1) resource pool are now two types: Leadership and Spirit.  Aragorn officially becomes both a "Leadership Hero" and a "Spirit Hero" for game purposes.

Name: Gondorian Spearman
Card Text: Response: After Gondorian Spearman is declared as a defender, deal 1 damage to the attacking enemy.
Notes: If the damage kills the attacking Enemy, the Enemy will not attack and is simply discarded along with its shadow card.

Name: Beorn (Core)
Card Text: Action: Beorn gains +5 Attack until the end of the phase. At the end of that phase in which you trigger this effect, shuffle Beorn back into your deck. (Limit once per round.)
Notes:
Always shuffled back into the original owner's deck, even if put into play under control of another player.
If Beorn is put into play via Sneak Attack (CORE 23) you can choose the order in which the end-of-phase events occur, which means he can go into either your hand or your deck. (official FAQ)

Name: Blade Mastery
Card Text: Action: Choose a character. Until the end of the phase, that character gains +1 Attack and +1 Defense.
Notes: The chosen character can belong to any player, and this event could be played more than once on the same character with the effects stacking.

Name: Rain of Arrows
Card Text: Action: Exhaust a character you control with the ranged keyword to choose a player. Deal 1 damage to each enemy engaged with that player.
Notes: You may choose yourself.  The chosen character does not actually attack which means they don't get any benefits from the attack (e.g. Legolas will not get any bonus if used for this event card).

Name: Feint
Card Text: Combat Action: Choose an enemy engaged with a player. That enemy cannot attack this phase.
Notes: Enemies attack one at a time, you must play this before the enemy begins its attack.  The shadow card will later be discarded with no effect.  No defender can be applied to this enemy since the enemy never attacks (official FAQ v1.1).

Name: Quick Strike
Card Text: Action: Exhaust a character you control to immediately declare it as an attacker (and resolve this attack) against any eligible enemy target.
Notes: A Ranged character can attack Enemies engaged with other players, Dúnhere (CORE 9) can attack Enemies in the staging area.  All other characters may only attack Enemies engaged with their controlling player.  This can be done during any player action window, potentially outside of the Combat phase.  This could allow the same player to attack the same enemy twice in the same turn.  No other characters can join the attack (official FAQ v1.2).

Name: Thicket of Spears
Card Text: You must use resources from 3 different heroes' pools to pay for this card. Action: Choose a player. That player's engaged enemies do not attack this phase.

Name: Swift Strike
Card Text: Response: After a character is declared as a defender, deal 2 damage to the attacking enemy.
Notes: If the damage kills the attacking Enemy, the Enemy will not complete its attack and is simply discarded along with its shadow card.  Multiple copies of this card may be played in response to a single character being declared as a defender.

Name: Stand Together
Card Text: Action: Choose a player. That player may declare any number of his eligible characters as defenders against each enemy attacking him this phase.
Notes:
Even though the cost is 0, you must still have a Tactics Hero under your control (alive and not captured) to play this card.
Sentinel characters from other players may not join the defense since they can only defend against undefended attacks, and by definition this attack will be defended.
Enemy's Attack strength is determined, Defense strength of all defenders are added together and subtracted from Attack strength, and all remaining Attack strength must be assigned as damage to a single defender. (official FAQ)

Name: Blade of Gondolin
Card Text: Attach to a hero. Restricted. Attached hero gets +1 Attack when attacking an Orc. Response: After attached hero attacks and destroys an enemy, place 1 progress token on the current quest.
Notes:
If you have an active Location, progress tokens are placed there instead of the current Quest card (official FAQ v1.1).
If Legolas completes a Quest card then this Response can place additional tokens on the next quest card, or vice-versa (if the quest only needs one progress token to be completed, you'd want to trigger this event first and then trigger Legolas's ability second (official FAQ v1.1).

Name: Citadel Plate
Card Text: Attach to hero. Restricted. Attached hero gets +4 Hit Points.
Notes: If the Citadel Plate is removed or lost for some reason, and the Hero's damage markers exceed his/her hit points, the Hero is killed.

Name: Dwarven Axe
Card Text: Attach to a hero. Restricted. Attached hero gains +1 Attack. (+2 Attack instead if attached hero is a Dwarf.)

Name: Horn of Gondor
Card Text: Attach to a hero. Restricted. Response: After a character leaves play, add 1 resource to attached hero's pool.
Notes:
Occurs after any character belonging to any player leaves play, could happen multiple times in a single phase.  After Sneak Attack (CORE 23) causes a character to leave play and after Gandalf (CORE 73) leaves play this is triggered as well. 
If the Hero with this attached dies, the attachment is gone and the Response doesn't trigger, which is OK because the Hero's resource pool is gone anyways.

Name: Wandering Took
Card Text: Action: Reduce your threat by 3 to give control of Wandering Took to another player. Raise that player's threat by 3.
Notes:
Action: This does not exhaust Wandering Took, you simply give control to another player and he remains in whatever state he was in before.  If he was the defender of an attack before you gave him to another player, that attack is now undefended.
When Wandering Took is removed from play, he is returned to his original owner's discard pile.  The Action is useless in a single-player game.

Name: Lórien Guide
Card Text: Response: After Lórien Guide commits to a quest, place 1 progress token on the active location.
Notes: If this progress token causes the Location to be explored, it is immediately discarded and any progress tokens from later this phase would apply to the Quest card.  If no active Location, no progress token is placed (i.e. can't be placed on Quest).

Name: Northern Tracker
Card Text: Response: After Northern Tracker commits to a quest, place 1 progress token on each location in the staging area.
Notes:
This Response occurs immediately after committing to the quest, before additional Encounter cards are drawn.  
If any Locations have progress tokens equal to their quest value, they are immediately considered explored and removed (rulebook p15).

Name: The Galadhrim's Greeting
Card Text: Action: Reduce one player's threat by 6, or reduce each player's threat by 2.

Name: Strength of Will
Card Text: Response: After you travel to a location, exhaust a Spirit character to place 2 progress tokens on that location.
Notes:
Even though the cost is 0, you must still have a Spirit Hero under your control (alive and not captured) to play this card.
If this causes the Location to be completed it is immediately discarded from play.  Any Travel or Forced keyword is resolved first (e.g. Tower Gate (CORE 107)) (official FAQ v1.1).  Multiple copies of this card can be triggered by the same travel event.

Name: Hasty Stroke
Card Text: Response: Cancel a shadow effect just triggered during combat.

Name: Will of the West
Card Text: Action: Choose a player. Shuffle that player's discard pile back into his deck.
Notes: If you choose yourself, Will of the West is discarded after the shuffling is completed so it won't be included in the shuffling.  Note that dead Heroes should not be shuffled back into the deck.

Name: A Test of Will
Card Text: Response: Cancel the "when revealed" effects of a card that was just revealed from the encounter deck.
Notes: Does not work for shadow effects.

Name: Stand and Fight
Card Text: Action: Choose an ally with a printed cost of X in any player's discard pile. Put that ally into play under your control. (The chosen ally can belong to any sphere of influence.)
Notes: Does not include Neutral Allies (official FAQ 1.2).  When Ally is removed from play, it is returned to its original owner's discard pile.  The cost of playing this Event is X Spirit resources; this allows you to put any non-Neutral Ally in-play with a cost up to X.  The cost of this card is considered to be 0 until played as an action.

Name: A Light in the Dark
Card Text: Action: Choose an enemy engaged with a player. Return that enemy to the staging area.
Notes: This enemy will once again contribute Threat during the next Quest Phase and may engage a player during the next Encounter Phase. (you probably want to play this card at the end of the Encounter Phase).

Name: Dwarven Tomb
Card Text: Action: Return 1 Spirit card from your discard pile to your hand.
Notes: Heroes can never be placed into your hand, so the card selected can't be a Hero.

Name: Fortune or Fate
Card Text: Action: Choose a hero in any player's discard pile. Put that card into play, under its owner's control.
Notes: Revived Hero no longer counts as dead for scoring purposes.  Can't return a Hero from an eliminated player.

Name: The Favor of the Lady
Card Text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains +1 Willpower.

Name: Power in the Earth
Card Text: Attach to a location. Attached location gets -1 Threat.
Notes: When the Location is explored, Power in the Earth returns to your discard pile.

Name: Unexpected Courage
Card Text: Attach to a hero. Action: Exhaust Unexpected Courage to ready attached hero.
Notes: This means the Hero will be able to do at least 2 things each game round (Quest, Defend, Attack, and any other actions that require exhausting the hero).  This can't be used to allow one player to attack the same enemy twice during your turn (official FAQ v1.1).

Name: Daughter of the Nimrodel
Card Text: Action: Exhaust Daughter of the Nimrodel to heal up to 2 damage on any 1 hero.
Notes: Note that after a character is dead it is too late to use this action, although during Combat phase you have an opportunity to heal before damage is applied which could save a character from death.  For example, if an enemy has Attack 6, and your Hero has 3 Health and 3 Defense, you could heal before damage is applied but the character is already at full health and it will have no impact.  But you can't heal after damage is dealt because the damage in this case would kill the character completely leaving no opportunity for healing.

Name: Erebor Hammersmith
Card Text: Response: After you play Erebor Hammersmith, return the topmost attachment in any player's discard pile to his hand.
Notes: Note that you have to play Erebor Hammersmith to get this effect. In other words, if you use a card (say Elf Stone) to put Erebor Hammersmith into play, that doesn't trigger the 'play' on Erebor Hammersmith. The distinction lies in the difference between playing (paying for and placing on the table) and putting into play (through some other mechanism).

Name: Henamarth Riversong
Card Text: Action: Exhaust Henamarth Riversong to look at the top card of the encounter deck.

Name: Miner of the Iron Hills
Card Text: Response: After Miner of the Iron Hills enters play, choose and discard 1 Condition attachment from play.
Notes: Remember, Responses are optional.  Can detach something like Caught in a Web (CORE 80) because it doesn't stipulate that you must control the attachment being discarded.

Name: Gléowine
Card Text: Action: Exhaust Gléowine to choose a player. That player draws 1 card.

Name: Lore of Imladris
Card Text: Action: Choose a character. Heal all damage from that character.
Notes: Note that after a character is dead it is too late to use this action, although during Combat phase you have an opportunity to heal before damage is applied which could save a character from death.  For example, if an enemy has Attack 6, and your Hero has 3 Health and 3 Defense, you could heal before damage is applied but the character is already at full health and it will have no impact.  But you can't heal after damage is dealt because the damage in this case would kill the character completely leaving no opportunity for healing.

Name: Lórien's Wealth
Card Text: Action: Choose a player. That player draws 3 cards.

Name: Radagast's Cunning
Card Text: Quest Action: Choose an enemy in the staging area. Until the end of the phase, that enemy does not contribute its Threat.

Name: Secret Paths
Card Text: Quest Action: Choose a location in the staging area. Until the end of the phase, that location does not contribute its Threat.

Name: Gandalf's Search
Card Text: Action: Look at the top X cards of any player's deck, add 1 of those cards to its owner's hand, and return the rest to the top of the deck in any order.
Notes: You choose how many resources to pay (so X would equal 1 if you paid 1, X would equal 3 if you paid 3).  Now this number of resources that you paid (X) is the number of cards you look at from the top of any player's deck.  The cost of this card is considered to be 0 until played as an action.

Name: Beorn's Hospitality
Card Text: Action: Choose a player. Heal all damage on each hero controlled by that player.
Notes: Note that after a Hero is dead it is out of play and will not heal.

Name: Forest Snare
Card Text: Attach to an enemy engaged with a player. Attached enemy cannot attack.
Notes:
Like all Attachments, this can only be played during the Planning phase.  You still control this Attachment even though you played it on an Enemy which can impact a few things (e.g. if you are eliminated from the game the card is discarded, or if you are forced to discard an attachment that you control).  As long as this remains attached, the enemy does not attack (it can't) or contribute any threat (it isn't in the staging area).
Enemy still is dealt a Shadow card but it is later (end of Combat Phase) discarded with no effect.  The shadow card is never resolved.

Name: Protector of Lórien
Card Text: Attach to a hero. Action: Discard a card from your hand to give attached hero +1 Defense or +1 Willpower until the end of the phase.
Notes:
Should read: "Action: Discard a card from your hand
to give attached hero +1 [Defense] or +1 [Willpower] until the end of the phase. Limit 3 times per phase.

Name: Dark Knowledge
Card Text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gets -1 Willpower. Response: Exhaust Dark Knowledge to look at 1 shadow card that was just dealt to an enemy attacking you.
Notes: Usable when the player who controls Dark Knowledge is being attacked.  Allows you to look at one shadow card after it is dealt but before you assign the defender, potentially allowing you to alter your choice of defender and/or heal before the card is officially revealed.

Name: Self Preservation
Card Text:
Attach to a character.
Action: Exhaust Self Preservation to heal 2 points of damage from attached character.
Notes: Note that after a character is dead it is too late to use this action, although during Combat phase you have an opportunity to heal before damage is applied which could save a character from death.  For example, if an enemy has Attack 6, and your Hero has 3 Health and 3 Defense, you could heal before damage is applied but the character is already at full health and it will have no impact.  But you can't heal after damage is dealt because the damage in this case would kill the character completely leaving no opportunity for healing.

Name: Gandalf (Core)
Card Text:
At the end of the round, discard Gandalf from play.
Response: After Gandalf enters play, (choose 1): draw 3 cards, deal 4 damage to 1 enemy in play, or reduce your threat by 5.
Notes: His "deal 4 damage" Response is not an attack and ignores the defensive strength of the Enemy and can be applied to any Enemy in-play (including an Enemy in the staging area).  Gandalf may still attack normally during the Combat Phase if you choose to use this ability.  Remember he is Unique so only one Gandalf can be played during each game phase (but at the end of the phase he will be gone allowing another one to be played).

Name: Bilbo Baggins (THfG)
Card Text: The first player draws 1 additional card in the resource phase.

Name: Dúnedain Mark
Card Text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains +1 Attack. Action: Pay 1 resource from attached hero's pool to attach Dúnedain Mark to another hero.

Name: Campfire Tales
Card Text: Action: Each player draws 1 card.

Name: Winged Guardian
Card Text: Winged Guardian cannot have restricted attachments. Forced: After an attack in which Winged Guardian defends resolves, pay 1 Tactics resource or discard Winged Guardian from play.
Notes: If two Winged Guardians are defending together using Stand Together (CORE 38), if one leaves play using Horn of Gordor (CORE 42), it is possible to generate the resource required for the other Winged Guardian to remain in-play.  The forced effect happens immediately after determining combat damage, before any player actions.

Name: The Eagles Are Coming!
Card Text: Action: Search the top 5 cards of your deck for any number of Eagle cards and add them to your hand.  Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
Notes: Even though the cost is 0, you still must have a Tactics hero under your control (alive and not captured) to play this card.

Name: Westfold Horse-Breaker
Card Text: Action: Discard Westfold Horse-Breaker to choose and ready a hero.
Notes:
Like all actions, the card must be in-play in order use the effect (can't be triggered from your hand).
Chosen hero can be controlled by any player and this works even if they have Caught in a Web attached.

Name: Mustering the Rohirrim
Card Text: Action: Search the top 10 cards of your deck for any 1 Rohan ally card and add it to your hand.  Then, shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

Name: Rivendell Minstrel
Card Text: Response: After you play Rivendell Minstrel from your hand, search your deck for 1 Song card and add it to your hand.  Shuffle your deck.
Notes: Note that this card is not a Minstrel (the name of a card does not change the specific traits that it has). Note also that you have to play (i.e. pay for and place on the table) the card for its effect to trigger. If the card is put into play from some other mechanism, the Minstrel's effect does not trigger.

Name: Strider's Path
Card Text: Response: After a location is revealed from the encounter deck, immediately travel to that location without resolving its Travel effect.  If another location is currently active, return it to the staging area.
Notes: Only ignores any Travel keyword, not a Forced keyword on the Location card.  You may still be able to travel to yet another location during the Travel Phase later.  A location returned to the staging area keeps its progress tokens.

Name: Song of Kings
Card Text: Attach to a hero.Attached hero gains a Leadership resource icon.
Notes: Note that this does not grant an extra resource token, it means all resource tokens in the Hero's resource pool are now two types: the Hero's original sphere and Leadership.  The Hero officially becomes a "Leadership Hero" for game purposes.

Name: Frodo Baggins (CatC)
Card Text: Response: After Frodo Baggins is damaged, cancel the damage and instead raise your threat by the amount of damage he would have been dealt. (Limit once per phase.)
Notes: Response: Frodo is still damaged (and in fact can take more damage than his 2 Health), but you get to cancel that damage.  So if he had Signs of Gollum (SoM 13), for example, he would still lose that card.  Remember that responses are always optional.

Name: Dúnedain Warning
Card Text:
Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains +1 Defense.
Action: Pay 1 resource from attached hero's pool to attach Dúnedain Warning to another hero.

Name: Second Breakfast
Card Text: Action: Each player returns the topmost attachment card from his discard pile to his hand.
Notes: This does not say "draw" so any limitations on drawing cards do not apply.

Name: Beorning Beekeeper
Card Text: Action: Discard Beorning Beekeeper from play to deal 1 damage to each enemy in the staging area.

Name: Born Aloft
Card Text:
Attach to an ally.
Action: Discard Born Aloft from play to return attached ally to its owner's hand.
Notes: Even though the cost is 0, you must still have a Tactics Hero under your control (alive and not captured) to play this card.

Name: Éomund
Card Text: Response: After Éomund leaves play, ready all Rohan characters in play.
Notes: Éomund has to be in-play before he can leave play.  You also can't voluntarily have him leave play: he needs to die or some other card effect needs to cause him to leave play.

Name: Nor am I a Stranger
Card Text: Attach to a character. Attached character gains the Rohan trait.

Name: Longbeard Map-Maker
Card Text: Action: Spend 1 Lore Resource to give Longbeard Map-Maker +1 Willpower until the end of the phase.

Name: A Burning Brand
Card Text:
Attach to Lore character.
While attached character is defending, cancel any shadow effects on cards dealt to the attacking enemy.
Notes: Only applied if the character defends the attack, not if a Hero takes damage due to an undefended attack.

Name: Song of Wisdom
Card Text:
Attach to a hero. 
Attached hero gains a Lore resource icon.
Notes: Note that this does not grant an extra resource token, it means all resource tokens in the Hero's resource pool are now two types: the Hero's original sphere and Lore.  The Hero officially becomes a "Lore Hero" for game purposes.

Name: Prince Imrahil (SoM)
Card Text: Response: After a character leaves play, ready Prince Imrahil. (Limit once per round.)

Name: Dúnedain Quest
Card Text:
Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains +1 Willpower.
Action: Pay 1 resource from attached hero's pool to attach Dúnedain Quest to another hero.

Name: Parting Gifts
Card Text: Action: Move any number of resource tokens from a Leadership hero's resource pool to any other hero's resource pool.
Notes:
Even though the cost is 0, you must still have a Leadership Hero under your control (alive and not captured) to play this card.
The resources, once moved, become the sphere(s) of the destination Hero.  Can't move to an Ally with a resource pool.

Name: Landroval
Card Text:
Landroval cannot have restricted attachments.
Response: After a hero card is destroyed, return Landroval to his owner's hand to put that hero back into play, with 1 damage token on it. (Limit once per game.)
Notes: Limit is once per game, per player.

Name: To the Eyrie
Card Text: Response: After an ally is destroyed, exhaust 1 Eagle character to move that ally from the discard pile to its owner's hand.
Notes: Destroyed means discarded into your own discard pile due to damage tokens equal or exceeding HP.

Name: Escort from Edoras
Card Text:
While committed to a quest, Escort from Edoras gets +2 Willpower.
Forced: After resolving a quest to which Escort from Edoras was committed, discard Escort from Edoras from play.
Notes: The forced effect occurs immediately after the last step of the quest phase, before any possible player actions.

Name: Ancient Mathom
Card Text:
Attach to a location.
Response: After attached location is explored, the first player draws 3 cards.
Notes: Ancient mathom, like other attachable cards, cannot be attached to immune player cards locations. (official FAQ)

Name: Heavy Stroke
Card Text: Response: After a Dwarf deals X damage to an enemy during combat, deal and additional X damage to that enemy. (Limit once per phase.)
Notes:
The way Heavy Stroke is intended to work depends on allowing players to choose which character's attack value is applied to the enemy's defense value. For example, the optimal way to play Heavy Stroke would be to apply Aragorn's attack 3 to an enemy's 1 defense. So Aragorn is dealing 2 damage to the enemy and Dwalin is also dealing 2 damage, at which point you play Heavy Stroke to double Dwalin's damage and make it 4 for a total of 6 damage dealt to the enemy.

Just to clarify it further, let's say Aragorn and Dwalin were attacking an enemy with 4 defense. The optimal way to play Heavy Stroke would be to apply all 3 of Aragron's attack plus 1 of Dwalin's to beating the enemy's defense, then Dwalin would deal 1 damage to the enemy that could be double with Heavy Stroke for a total of 2. (Caleb)

Cycle: The Voice of Isengard &The Ring Maker

Card Text: Attach to a Warrior hero. Response: After you optionally engage an enemy, exhaust Captain of Gondor to give attached hero +1 Attack and +1 Defense until the end of the round.

Cycle: The Voice of Isengard &The Ring Maker

Name: Shadows Give Way
Card Text: You must use resources from 3 different heroes' pools to pay for this card. Action: Discard each shadow card from each enemy in play.
Cycle: The Voice of Isengard &The Ring Maker

Card Text: Response: When an encounter card is revealed but before resolving any of that card's keywords or "when revealed" effects, choose a character comited to the quest. Ready that character and remove it from the quest.

Name: Waters of Nimrodel
Card Text: Action: Heal all damage on each character in play.

Name: Aragorn (TLR)
Card Text: Each enemy engaged with you gets -1 Defense. Response: After Aragorn participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, choose an enemy not engaged with you and engage that enemy.

Name: Halbarad
Card Text: While you are engaged with any enemy, Halbarad does not exhaust to commit to a quest. You may optionally engage 1 additional enemy during the encounter phase.

Name: Weather Hills Watchman
Card Text: Response: After Weather Hills Watchman enters play, search the top 5 cards of your deck for a Signal card and add it to your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

Name: Dúnedain Hunter
Card Text: Forced: After Dúnedain Hunter enters play, search the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for a non-unique enemy and put it into play engaged with you. If no enemy enters play by this effect, discard Dúnedain Hunter. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Name: Sarn Ford Sentry
Card Text: Response: After Sarn Ford Sentry enters play, draw 1 card for each enemy engaged with you.

Name: Warden of Annúminas
Card Text: Warden of Annúminas gets +1 Willpower for each enemy engaged with you.

Name: Ranger Summons
Card Text: Play only if you control a Dúnedain hero. Planning Action: Shuffle 1 of your set aside Ranger of the North allies with the encounter keyword into the encounter deck. Then, remove Ranger Summons from the game.

Name: Tireless Hunters
Card Text: Play only before the resolving enemy attacks step. Combat Action: Choose an enemy not engaged with you. Engage that enemy. Then, discard a shadow card from that enemy, if able.

Name: Expert Trackers
Card Text: Response: After you engage an enemy, exhaust a Scout or Ranger character to place X progress tokens on a location. X is the engaged enemy's printed Threat.

Name: Heir of Valandil
Card Text: Attach to a Dúnedain hero. Planning Action: Exhaust Heir of Valandil to reduce the cost of the next Dúnedain ally you play this phase by 1 for each enemy engaged with you.

Name: Athelas
Card Text: Attach to a Dúnedain or Healer character. Action: Discard Athelas and exhaust attached character to heal all damage on a character. You may discard a Condition attachment from that character.

Name: Secret Vigil
Card Text: Attach to an enemy. Limit 1 per enemy. Attached enemy gets -1 Threat. Response: When attached enemy is destroyed, reduce each player's threat by the attached enemy's printed Threat.

Name: Star Brooch
Card Text: Attach to a Dúnedain or Noldor hero. Limit 1 per hero. While you are engaged with an enemy, attached hero gets +1 Willpower and cannot have its Willpower reduced.

Name: Gather Information
Card Text: Limit 1 per deck. Response: After this stage is defeated, each player may search his deck for 1 card and add it to his hand. Each player shuffles his deck.

Name: Ranger of the North
Card Text: When Revealed: The first player chooses a player to take control of Ranger of the North. Then, either deal 2 damage to an enemy or place 2 progress tokens on a location.

Name: Merry (TWoE)
Card Text: Response: After an enemy is revealed from the top of the encounter deck, exhaust Merry to reduce your threat by that enemy's Threat.

Name: Ingold
Card Text: Ingold gets +1 Willpower for each hero you control with at least 1 resource in its resource pool.

Name: Rallying Cry
Card Text: Response: After an ally leaves play, add it to its owner’s hand instead of placing it in the discard pile. Valour Action: Until the end of the phase, add each ally that leaves play to its owner's hand instead of placing it in the discard pile.

Name: Honour Guard
Card Text: Response: Exhaust Honour Guard to cancel 1 point of damage just dealt to a character. Valour Response: Exhaust and discard Honour Guard to cancel up to 5 damage just dealt to a character.

Name: Raven-winged Helm
Card Text: Attach to a hero with sentinel. Limit 1 per hero. Response: Exhaust Raven-winged Helm to prevent 1 point of damage just dealt to attached character.

Name: Curious Brandybuck
Card Text: Forced: After the active location is explored, place Curious Brandybuck on the bottom of its owner's deck. Response: After you travel to a location, put Curious Brandybuck into play from your hand, under any player's control.

Name: Hobbit Pony
Card Text: Attach to a Hobbit hero. Quest Action: If attached hero is not committed to the quest, exhaust Hobbit Pony and attached hero to commit attached hero to the quest.

Name: East Road Ranger
Card Text: East Road Ranger gets +2 Willpower while committed to a side quest.

Name: Scout Ahead
Card Text: Limit 1 per deck. Response: When this stage is defeated, the first player searches the top X cards of the encounter deck for 1 non-objective card worth no victory points and adds it to the victory display. Put the remaining cards back in any order. X is the number of players in the game plus 4.

Name: Ranger of Cardolan
Card Text: Response: After you engage an enemy, if you control at least 1 Dúnedain hero, spend 1 resource to put Ranger of Cardolan into play from your hand, under your control. At the end of the round, if Ranger of Cardolan is still in play, shuffle it into its owner's deck.

Name: Rossiel
Card Text: If the active location shares a Trait with a location in the victory display, Rossiel gets +2 Willpower. If the attacking enemy shares a Trait with an enemy in the victory display, Rossiel gets +2 Defense.

Name: Veteran of Osgiliath
Card Text: Veteran of Osgiliath gets +1 Willpower, +1 Attack, and +1 Defense while your threat is 40 or higher.

Name: Descendants of Kings
Card Text: Ready up to X Dúnedain characters you control. X is the number of enemies engaged with you.

Name: Derndingle Warrior
Card Text: Cannot have restricted attachments. Enters play exhausted. While Derndingle Warrior is defending, it gains: "Action: Deal 1 damage to Derndingle Warrior to give it +3 Defense for this attack." (Limit once per attack.)

Name: Boomed and Trumpeted
Card Text: Response: After an Ent character takes any amount of damage, ready it. That character gets +3 Attack until the end of the phase.

Name: Elven Jeweler
Card Text: Discard 2 cards from your hand to put Elven Jeweler into play from your hand, under your control.

Name: Double Back
Card Text: Limit 1 per deck. Response: When this stage is defeated, reduce each player's threat by 5.

Name: Leave No Trace
Card Text: Limit 3 copies of Leave No Trace in the victory display. Response: After a non-unique location is explored, add Leave No Trace to the victory display to add that location to the victory display.

Name: Distant Stars
Card Text: Action: Exhaust a Ranger or Scout character to discard a non-unique active location. Then, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a non-unique location and make it the active location. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Name: Keen as Lances
Card Text: Reduce the cost to play Keen as Lances by 1 for each card worth no victory points in the victory display. Action: Add Keen as Lances to the victory display. Then, choose one: add 2 resources to a hero's resource pool, draw 3 cards, or reduce your threat by 4.

Name: Dori (AtE)
Card Text: Response: After another hero is declared as a defender, exhaust Dori to add his Defense to the defending hero's Defense for this attack.

Name: Ranger Provisions
Card Text: Attach to a location. Limit 1 per location. Response: After attached location is explored, the first player adds 1 resource to each of his heroes' resource pools.

Name: Dúnedain Message
Card Text: Action: Search your deck for a side quest and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

Name: Longbeard Sentry
Card Text: Action: Discard 2 cards from the top of your deck to give Longbeard Sentry sentinel and +1 Defense until the end of the phase. (Limit once per phase.)

Name: Delay the Enemy
Card Text: Limit 1 per deck. Response: When this stage is defeated, each player may choose and discard a non-unique enemy engaged with him.

Name: Steed of Imladris
Card Text: Attach to a Spirit or Noldor hero. Response: After attached hero commits to a quest, discard a card from your hand to place 2 progress on the active location.

Name: Fair and Perilous
Card Text: Action: Choose a Noldor or Silvan character. Until the end of the phase, add that character's Willpower to its Attack.

Name: Wellinghall Preserver
Card Text: Cannot have restricted attachments. Enters play exhausted. Response: After Wellinghall Preserver readies, heal 1 damage from an Ent character.

Name: None Return
Card Text: Limit 3 copies of None Return in the victory display. Response: After a non-unique enemy is destroyed, add None Return to the victory display to add that enemy to the victory display.

Name: Hope Rekindled
Card Text: Action: Reduce the cost of the next event that has a Valour trigger you play this phase by 2. Valour Action: Search the top 10 cards of your deck for an event that has a Valour trigger and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

Name: Erestor (TToR)
Card Text: Draw 3 additional cards at the beginning of the resource phase. At the end of the round, discard all cards in your hand.

Name: Reinforcements
Card Text: You must use resources from 3 different heroes' pools to play this card. Action: The players, as a group, can put up to 2 allies into play from their hands. Each of these allies may enter play under any player's control. At the end of the phase, return each of those allies that are still in play to their owners' hands.

Name: Send for Aid
Card Text: Limit 1 per deck. Response: When this stage is defeated, each player may search the top 10 cards of his deck for an ally and put it into play under his control. Each player who did shuffles his deck.

Name: Elven Spear
Card Text: Attach to a Noldor or Silvan hero. Action: Discard a card from your hand to give attached hero +1 Attack until the end of the phase. Limit 3 times per phase.

Name: Horn's Cry
Card Text: Action: All enemies get -1 Attack until the end of the phase. Valour Action: Choose a player. Each enemy engaged with that player gets -3 Attack until the end of the phase.

Name: Galadhrim Weaver
Card Text: Cannot attack or defend. Response: After Galadhrim Weaver enters play, shuffle the top card of your discard pile into your deck.

Name: Silver Harp
Card Text: Attach to a Spirit hero. Response: After a card is discarded from your hand, exhaust Silver Harp to return that card to your hand.

Name: Galdor of the Havens (TToR)
Card Text: Response: After 1 or more cards are discarded from your hand, draw 1 card. Limit once per round.

Name: The Door is Closed!
Card Text: Response: After an encounter card is revealed from the encounter deck, cancel its effects and discard it if there is a card with the same title in the victory display.

Name: Elf-friend

Name: Amarthiúl
Card Text: While you are engaged with at least 1 enemy, Amarthiúl gains the Tactics resource icon. While you are engaged with at least 2 enemies, add 1 additional resource to Amarthiúl's resource pool when you collect resources during the resource phase.

Name: Guardian of Arnor
Card Text: Guardian of Arnor gets +1 Defense for each enemy engaged with you.

Name: Doom Hangs Still

Card Text: Cannot have restricted attachments. Enters play exhausted. Response: After Beechbone is declared as an attacker, deal 1 damage to him to deal X damage to the defending enemy. X is the amount of damage on Beechbone.

Name: Hold Your Ground!
Card Text: Action: Choose and ready a sentinel character. Valour Action: Ready all sentinel characters.

Name: Lindir
Card Text: Response: After Lindir enters play, if you have less than 3 cards in your hand, draw until you have 3 cards in your hand.

Name: Lords of the Eldar
Card Text: Lords of the Eldar can only be played from your discard pile. Action: Place Lords of the Eldar on the bottom of your deck from your discard pile. Then, until the end of the round all Noldor characters get +1 Willpower, +1 Attack, and +1 Defense.

Name: The Long Defeat
Card Text: Attach to a quest card in play. Limit 1 per quest. Response: After attached quest card is defeated, each player either draws 2 cards or heals up to 5 damage from among characters he controls.

Card Text: Response: Exhaust a Dúnedain or Ranger hero to cancel an enemy card just revealed from the encounter deck. Then, shuffle it back into the encounter deck and reveal an additional encounter card.

Name: Éothain

Name: Sword of Númenor

Name: Fornost Bowman
Card Text: Fornost Bowman gets +1 Attack for each enemy engaged with you.

Card Text: Action: Choose a hero. Until the end of the phase, the chosen hero does not exhaust to attack or defend. Valour Action: Choose a player. Until the end of the phase, each of that player's heroes do not exhaust to attack or defend.

Name: Elven-light
Card Text: Elven-light can only be played from your discard pile. Action: Return Elven-light to your hand from your discard pile. Then, draw 1 card.

Name: Tale of Tinúviel
Card Text: Action: Exhaust a Noldor character to ready a Dúnedain character, or vice-versa. Until the end of the phase, add the exhausted character's printed Willpower to the other character's Willpower, Attack, and Defense.

Name: Galadhrim Healer
Card Text: Response: After Galadhrim Healer enters play, choose a player. Heal 1 damage from each hero controlled by that player.

Name: Weather-stained Cloak
Card Text: Attach to a Ranger character. Limit 1 per character. While attached character is commited to the quest, Weather-stained cloak gains: "Response: Exhaust Weather-stained Cloak to cancel 1 point of damage just dealt to attached character.

Name: Sword-thain
Card Text: Attach to a unique ally belonging to any sphere of influence. Attached character loses the ally card type and gains the hero card type.

Name: Círdan the Shipwright
Card Text: Draw 1 additional card at the beginning of the resource phase. Forced: After drawing cards at the beginning of the resource phase, choose and discard 1 of those cards.

Name: Galdor of the Havens (TGH)
Card Text: Response: After drawing your setup hand, instead of taking a mulligan, you may discard any number of cards from your hand. Then, draw that many cards. Action: If you have no cards in your hand, draw 6 cards. (Limit once per game.)

Name: Mithlond Sea-watcher
Card Text: While the top card of your discard pile is an ally, Mithlond Sea-watcher gets +2 Attack and gains ranged.

Name: Skyward Volley
Card Text: As an additional cost to play Skyward Volley, exhaust a ranged character you control. Combat Action: Deal 2 damage to an enemy engaged with a player. Resolve that effect again for each copy of Skyward Volley currently in your discard pile (you may choose different targets).

Name: Grappling Hook
Card Text: Attach to a character. Quest Action: Discard Grappling Hook and exhaust attached character to commit attached character to the quest, using its Attack instead of its Willpower (or instead of its Defense if the current quest has the siege keyword).

Name: Warden of the Havens
Card Text: While the top card of your discard pile is an attachment, Warden of the Havens gets +2 Defense and gains sentinel.

Name: Anchor Watch
Card Text: Response: After an enemy is declared as an attacker against you, declare an exhausted character you control as the defender. Resolve that effect again for each copy of Anchor Watch currently in your discard pile (all chosen characters are defending against this attack).

Name: Mariner's Compass
Card Text: Attach to a Leadership or a Scout character. Response: At the beginning of the travel phase, exhaust Mariner's Compass and attached character to search the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for a location. Switch that location with a location in the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Name: Lindon Navigator
Card Text: Lindon Navigator does not exhaust to commit to a quest, and can commit to quests while exhausted. Forced: After resolving a quest to which Lindon Navigator was committed, either discard it from play or discard 1 card from your hand.

Name: The Evening Star
Card Text: Action: Place 2 progress on any location. Resolve that effect again for each copy of The Evening Star currently in your discard pile (you may choose new targets).

Name: Explorer's Almanac
Card Text: Attach to a location in the staging area. Progress from questing successfully may be placed on the attached location before it is placed on the current quest.

Name: Sailor of Lune
Card Text: While the top card of your discard pile is an event, Sailor of Lune gets +1 Willpower and gains: "Cannot be damaged while committed to the quest.

Name: Elwing's Flight
Card Text: Quest Action: Ready a questing character and give that character +1 Willpower until the end of the phase. Resolve that effect again for each copy of Elwing's Flight currently in your discard pile (you may choose different targets).

Name: To the Sea, to the Sea!
Card Text: Attach to a Noldor character. Action: Exhaust To the Sea, to the Sea! and discard X cards from your hand to reduce the cost of the next Noldor ally played this phase by X (to a minimum of 1).

Name: Narya
Card Text: Attach to Círdan the Shipwright or Gandalf. Attached character gains a Leadership resource icon. Action: Exhaust Narya and attached character to choose and ready up to 2 allies. Each of those allies gets +1 Attack and +1 Defense until the end of the phase.

Name: Denethor (FofS)
Card Text: Setup: Add 2 resources to Denethor's resource pool. Action: Move 1 resource from Denethor's resource pool to another Gondor hero's resource pool. (Limit once per round.)

Name: Rod of the Steward
Card Text: Attach to a Gondor hero. Action: Spend 2 resources from attached hero's resource pool to draw 1 card.

Name: In Service of the Steward
Card Text: Attach to a character. Attached character gains the Gondor trait.

Name: Azain Silverbeard
Card Text: Response: After Azain Silverbeard participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, spend 1 Tactics resource to deal 2 damage to another enemy that shares a Trait with the destroyed enemy. Any player may trigger this response.

Name: Last Stand
Card Text: Response: After a Warrior character is destroyed while defending against an enemy attack, deal damage to the attacking enemy equal to that character's printed Attack.

Name: Glorfindel
Card Text: Glorfindel can be played from your discard pile. Action: Discard a card from your hand to ready Glorfindel. (Limit once per phase.)

Name: Tides of Fate
Card Text: Response: When a shadow card increases an enemy's Attack by any amount, increase the defending character's Defense by 3 for that attack. Then, the players as a group may spend 2 Tactics resources to ready the defending character and give it +3 Attack for its next attack this phase.

Name: Imladris Caregiver
Card Text: Action: Discard a card from your hand to heal 1 damage on any characer. (Limit twice per round).

Name: Heed the Dream
Card Text: Action: Choose a player. That player searches the top 5 cards of his deck for a card, adds it to his hand, and shuffles his deck. Then, players as a group may spend 3 Leadership resources to have that player search his deck for another card, add it to his hand, and shuffle his deck.

Name: Guardian of Rivendell
Card Text: As an additional cost to play Guardian of Rivendell from your hand, you must discard 2 cards from your hand.

Name: Vanish from Sight
Card Text: Play only if you control 2 or fewer heroes. Action: Until the end of the phase, if your threat is higher than 20, treat your threat as if it is 20.

Name: Lanwyn
Card Text: Response: After an encounter card with surge is revealed, either ready Lanwyn or give her +2 Willpower until the end of the phase. (Limit twice per phase.)

Name: Eldahir
Card Text: Action: Spend 1 Lore resource to look at a facedown shadow card dealt to an engaged enemy. If that card has a shadow effect, Eldahir gets +2 Defense until the end of the phase. Any player may trigger this action. (Limit once per phase.)

Name: Captain's Wisdom
Card Text: Resource Action: Exhaust a Noble hero you control to add 2 resources to that hero's resource pool.

Name: Master Ironsmith
Card Text: Response: After you play Master Ironsmith from your hand, if you paid all of its resource cost from a single hero's resource pool, attach a Weapon or Armor attachment from your hand or discard pile to that hero without paying its resource cost.

Name: Raiment of War
Card Text: Attach to a Warrior character. Raiment of War counts as 2 Restricted attachments. Attached character gets +1 Attack, +1 Defense and +2 hit points.

Name: Sam Gamgee (TTitD)
Card Text: Reduce the cost to play Sam Gamgee by 2 if you control Frodo Baggins. Response: After a player raises his threat, that player may spend 1 Spirit resource to ready Sam Gamgee. He gets +1 Willpower, +1 Attack and +1 Defense until the end of the round. (Limit once per round.)

Name: Elevenses
Card Text: Play only after the staging step. Quest Action: Choose X questing Hobbit characters you control. Ready each chosen character and remove them from the quest. Then, reduce your threat by X.

Name: Mirkwood Explorer
Card Text: Response: After Mirkwood Explorer quests successfully, place 1 progress on it. Action: Exhaust Mirkwood Explorer to move all progress from it to a location in play.

Name: Guarded Ceaselessly
Card Text: Attach to a location. Action: Exhaust a Ranger or Scout character to give attached location -2 Threat until the end of the phase.

Name: Elfhelm
Card Text: Each Spirit hero with an attached Mount gets +1 Willpower. Each Tactics hero with an attached Mount gets +1 Attack. Each Leadership hero with an attached Mount gets +1 Defense.

Name: Ceorl
Card Text: Action: Spend 1 Spirit resource to ready Ceorl. Then, you may give control of Ceorl to another player. Any player may trigger this action. (Limit once per phase).

Name: Armored Destrier
Card Text: Attach to a Leadership or sentinel hero. Response: After attached hero defends against an attack, exhaust Armored Destrier to ready attached hero. Then, discard a shadow card from another enemy engaged with the defending player.

Name: Déorwine
Card Text: Response: While Déorwine is defending, spend 1 Leadership resource to cancel a shadow effect dealt to the attacking enemy. Any player may trigger this action.

Name: Revealed in Wrath
Card Text: Play only if you control a Noldor hero. Action: Choose a non-unique enemy. Until the end of the phase, treat the chosen enemy's printed text box as if it were blank (except for Traits).

Name: Rhovanion Outrider
Card Text: Response: After Rhovanion Outrider coomits to the quest, place 1 progress on a location in the staging area. If that location is not explored by this effect, give Rhovanion Outrider +1 Willpower until the end of the phase.

Name: Scouting Party
Card Text: Response: After you commit characters to the quest, if each character you have commited to the quest is a Scout, each of these characters gets +2 Willpower until the end of the phase.

Name: Entangling Nets
Card Text: Play Entagling Nets into the staging area, unattached. If unattached, attach Entangling Nets to the next eligible enemy that enters the staging area. Attached enemy gets -2 Attack and -2 Defense.

Name: Arrows from the Trees
Card Text: Play only after making engagement checks. Encounter Action: If no enemies were engaged this phase, deal 1 damage to each enemy in the staging area. Then, the players as a group may spend 3 Tactics resources to deal 2 additional damage to each enemy in the staging area.

Name: Ered Luin Miner
Card Text: Response: After Ered Luin Miner is discarded from the top of your deck, put it into play under your control.

Name: Argalad
Card Text: Action: Exhaust Argalad to choose an enemy in the staging area. Until the end of the phase, that enemy gets -X Threat, where X is Argalad's Attack. If this effect reduces the enemy's Threat to 0, deal 1 damage to it. (Limit once per round.)

Name: Dwarven Sellsword
Card Text: Forced: At the end of the round, discard Dwarven Sellsword unless the players as a group spend 1 Leadership resource.

Name: Dúnedain Remedy
Card Text: Attach to a hero. Response: After Dúnedain Remedy is attached to a hero, heal 1 damage on that hero. Action: Pay 1 resource from attached hero's resource pool to attach Dúnedain Remedy to another hero.

Name: Marksman of Lórien
Card Text: Response: After Marksman of Lórien enters play, choose an enemy. That enemy gets -2 Defense until the end of the round.

Name: Battle-fury
Card Text: Play only before the staging step. Quest Action: Exhaust a hero you control to immediately declare it as an attacker (and resolve its attack) against any eligible enemy target. Then, the players as a group may spend 1 Spirit resource to commit that hero to the quest.

Name: Woodland Courier
Card Text: Response: After Woodland Courier enters play, place 1 progress on a location (2 progress instead if that location has the Forest trait).

Name: Hithlain
Card Text: Attach to a location. Limit 1 per location. Response: After a player plays a Silvan ally from his hand, place 1 progress on attached location.

Name: Robin Smallburrow
Card Text: Response: After you travel to a location, spend 1 Spirit resource to raise the engagement cost of each enemy in play by X until the end of the round, where X is that location's quest points. Any player may trigger this response.

Name: Interrogation
Card Text: Action: Choose an enemy with an attached Trap card. Look at the top X cards of the encounter deck, where X is that enemy's printed Threat. You may discard 1 of those cards. Return the rest to the top of the deck, in the same order.

Name: Strider
Card Text: Attach to a hero. While you control 2 or fewer heroes, attached hero does not exhaust to commit to the quest. While you control 5 or fewer characters, attached hero gets +2 Willpower.

Name: Na'asiyah
Card Text: Resources in Na'asiyah's resource pool cannot be used to pay for allies. Action: While Na'asiyah is attacking or defending, pay 1 resource from her resource pool to give her +2 Attack or +2 Defense for this attack.

Name: Rune-master
